ygData.subject: Re: Why did you choose to play a paladin?
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello all, I m a little late in responding to this message, but that s because I was busy planning my wedding to fellow Paladin Yummy. We are both on the
ygData.messageBody:
Hello all, I'm a little late in responding to this message, but that's
because I was busy planning my wedding to fellow Paladin Yummy. We are
both on the Bertoxx server and we are pleased to announce that the wedding
was a resounding success! We even had a GM help some spectators get to the
island in the Ocean of Tears, then he stayed for the Ceremony! There will
be screenshots posted on our guild's web site at
http://home.att.net/~fendain

Now to answer the question:

I chose a Paladin for many of the same reasons as the rest of you.
On reason is my fascination with the Knight of the Round Table and I
figured that an excellent representation would be a Paladin. I'm
half-elven and enjoy the advantage of gettin along with Humans and elves.
I too play the hero and have sacraficed myself for companions numerous
times. (maybe that's why I'm still only lvl 12) But I enjoy helping those
in need and my gallant nature helps me make friends very easily.

(By the way, On the Bertoxx server, you can buy a banded Tunic for 16pp!
Someone I met and helped out has been giving me even better prices than
that too!)

I also enjoy being able to dish out damamge and laugh when Orc Legions
attack me (but I do warn everyone and fight delaying actions when out
numbered 3 to 1 or more, OUCH!) The magic is a nice touch, and I find it
amusing to see someone watching you get hit over and over, then heal right
back up again with LOH. They often times shake there head in wonder, then
compliment me on my prowess. It gives me a warm feeling inside. What can I
say, I enjoy being the envy of others.

Anyway that's my dime

General Reppik, Clan Battlehammer
Paladin of the 12th order Of Erollisi Marr
Bertoxxulous
